to organise (party, event), to hold (a ceremony)
to decide, to make a decision
<<ability>> can/able to (having the skill to do sth)
<<limitation>> as much as, as far as, to the extent that

{state v.} to need, to desire, (formal) "(I) would like..."
(if...) soon (sth) will then... (often used as a caution)
to endure/tolerate, to put up with
{adv.} (to do sth) to the full capacity, to do (one's) best
{v.} to apply for (a job, a course), to register
{adv.} (to do sth) by (one)self, (without help from others)
for (the sake of sb), in order to
to collect, to keep, to save (money)
to discard, to throw away (sth), to leave/abandon (sb)
to bother, (polite request) "Could I bother you...?"
to deposit, to leave (sth) with (sb), to entrust
{part.} used to urging/convincing sb to do sth
{part.} used in negative requests to urge sb not to do sth
to allow/let (sb) to..., to have/make (sb do sth)
a small thing, not a big deal
{prefix} <<sth is appealing, worth doing, or should be done>>
to try (doing sth), to attempt to
{v.} to suggest, to recommend (that..., sb to...)
{v.} to warn, to remind (that..., sb to...)
